meta.title: Biochemistry E&D - Mission NEET PG 2.0 - Final Batch - 16-06-2025 - 2025-06-16

questions.text: Which of the following statements about the malate-aspartate shuttle is false?

options.label: A
options.text: It is used to transport NADH from Cytosol to Mitochondria

options.label: B
options.text: It is used to transport NADH from Mitochondria to cytoplasm

options.label: C
options.text: Malate get converted to Oxaloacetate and release NADH

options.label: D
options.text: Oxaloacetate is reconstituted from Aspartate and α Ketoglutarate

questions.correct_answer: B. It is used to transport NADH from Mitochondria to cytoplasm
questions.explanation: Ans. B) It is used to transport NADH from Mitochondria to cytoplasm

questions.text: A 3-year-old child presents with hypoglycaemia and metabolic acidosis. Laboratory investigations reveal a genetic disorder that causes the liver enzyme fructose 1,6-bisphosphatase to be more sensitive to inhibition by fructose 2,6-bisphosphate. This enzyme is a crucial regulatory point in gluconeogenesis. Based on this enzymatic defect, which of the following metabolic changes would be expected in this child?

options.label: A
options.text: Level of fructose 1,6-biphosphate is lower than normal

options.label: B
options.text: Level of fructose 1,6-biphosphate is higher than normal

questions.correct_answer: B. Level of fructose 1,6-biphosphate is higher than normal
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Level of fructose 1,6-biphosphate is higher than normal

questions.text: In an investigation on the regulation of metabolic pathways through phosphorylation and dephosphorylation, a researcher studies the effect of these post-translational modifications on various enzymes. One particular focus is on enzymes whose catalytic activity is diminished upon dephosphorylation. Which enzyme listed below has its activity reduced through dephosphorylation?

A 35-year-old individual who consumed fast food from a street vendor for several days recently comes to a hospital with continuous vomiting over the last two days. Despite not being able to eat or drink much, the patient's blood glucose levels remain stable. Which organ has played the primary role in maintaining this individual's blood glucose level in this duration?

A teenager suffering from type V glycogen storage disease is getting examined by a rubber ball squeezing test while exercising her forearm. Which of following statements will be true for this patient compared to a normal person?

options.label: A
options.text: ↑ blood glucose in the blood drawn from the exercising forearm vein

options.label: C
options.text: ↑ blood lactate in the blood drawn from the exercising forearm vein

options.label: D
options.text: Relatively ↓ blood lactate in the blood drawn from the exercising forearm vein

questions.correct_answer: D. Relatively ↓ blood lactate in the blood drawn from the exercising forearm vein
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Relatively ↓ blood lactate in the blood drawn from the exercising forearm vein

questions.text: A young man feels unwell after eating dairy products, leading to gas, bloating, and diarrhea. When he stops eating dairy, these problems go away. To manage his symptoms, he could benefit from a supplement containing which of the following enzyme?

A full-term female infant failed to gain weight and showed metabolic acidosis in the neonatal period. A physical examination at 6 months showed failure to thrive, hypotonia, small muscle mass, severe head lag, and a persistent acidosis (pH 7.0 to 7.2). Blood lactate, pyruvate, and alanine were greatly elevated. Treatment with thiamine did not alleviate the lactic acidosis. Which of the following enzymes is most likely deficient in this patient?

A 2-year-old child presents to the pediatric outpatient department with a week-long fever but otherwise normal physical examination findings. To rule out an inborn error of metabolism, a urine screening test is performed, yielding the following results: Benedict’s test – positive, Blood Glucose - 110 mg %, Bial’s test - positive, Urine glucose, fructose and galactose - Negative. What is your most probable diagnosis?
A child with low blood glucose is unable to do glycogenolysis or gluconeogenesis. Which of the following enzyme is missing in the child?
In the context of Infantile conditions, hypoglycemia is observed in which of the following?

A 4-year-old boy experiences headache, dizziness, weakness, and knee joint tenderness after consuming sugarcane juice. Following a diagnosis of Hereditary Fructose Intolerance (HFI), which of the following statements about HFI is false?
questions.correct_answer: C. Hyperglycaemia on giving fruit juice
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Hyperglycaemia on giving fruit juice

questions.text: A 6-year-old boy is evaluated for joint stiffness and gait difficulties that have persisted for the last three months. Additionally, he is experiencing visual disturbances. On examination, the patient exhibits hepatosplenomegaly, coarse facial features including a short neck, low-set ears, a depressed nasal bridge, and is found to have a low IQ. Urinary tests reveal the presence of heparan sulfate and dermatan sulfate, and a fibroblast assay indicates a deficiency of the enzyme L-Iduronidase. Based on these findings, the child has been diagnosed with mucopolysaccharidosis (MPS). Which specific type of MPS is indicated by these clinical and laboratory findings?

A medical student is studying the unique metabolic pathways of erythrocytes (red blood cells). Due to the absence of mitochondria, erythrocytes rely on glycolysis for ATP production. Within this context, the student is interested in the yield of ATP from glucose through the Rapoport-Luebering cycle. What is the net gain of ATP by this cycle in red blood cells from one molecule of glucose?

A young woman with laboratory picture of normocytic anaemia and jaundice with splenomegaly was diagnosed to have RBC pyruvate kinase deficiency after a PBS showed spiculated cells. Due to the abnormal function of pyruvate kinase, less pyruvate is formed and the intermediates above pyruvate in the glycolytic pathway get accumulated. Which of the following products is not formed in appropriate amounts in the RBC due to the deficiency of pyruvate?

During the conversion of α-ketoglutarate to succinate in the TCA cycle, several reactions occur, leading to the production of energy-rich molecules. This conversion involves the decarboxylation of α-ketoglutarate, the generation of Succinyl CoA, and the subsequent formation of succinate. How many ATP molecules are typically produced through this series of reactions?
ADP and ATP transfer in mitochondria is affected by:

The electron transport chain (ETC) plays a critical role in the final stages of energy production within mitochondria. This complex system involves a series of electron carriers that facilitate the transfer of electrons, culminating in ATP synthesis. Among the list below, which component is not involved in the mitochondrial electron transport chain?
Phenomenon of Cancer cells consuming more glucose because:

options.label: A
options.text: Lactic acid is produced despite presence of oxygen

options.label: B
options.text: Enhanced conversion of glucose to pyruvate

options.label: C
options.text: Increased pyruvate to acetyl coA (High NADH/ NAD ratio)

questions.correct_answer: A. Lactic acid is produced despite presence of oxygen
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Lactic acid is produced despite presence of oxygen

questions.text: A medical student is reviewing the mechanisms of nutrient absorption in the small intestine, particularly the transport of glucose across the intestinal epithelium. The student learns about different glucose transporters and their specific roles. Which transporter is responsible for the transport of glucose on the contraluminal side (basolateral membrane) of the intestinal epithelial cells?

PG Junior Residents of Biochemistry department are discussing a complex case of metabolic disorder; a debate arises regarding the metabolic flexibility of pyruvate under various physiological conditions. A senior consultant poses a question to the team to clarify the understanding of pyruvate metabolism. Which of the following is a fate of pyruvate in human metabolism?

During a case discussion on genetic disorders affecting lipid metabolism, a patient with a diagnosis of abetalipoproteinemia is reviewed. Given the nature of this disorder, which vitamin deficiency is likely to occur in this patient?
Which of the following processes yields arachidonic acid in mammals?

options.label: B
options.text: Chain elongation and one desaturation of linolenic acid

options.label: C
options.text: Chain elongation and two desaturations of linoleic acid

questions.correct_answer: C. Chain elongation and two desaturations of linoleic acid
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Chain elongation and two desaturations of linoleic acid

questions.text: Acetyl CoA can be directly converted to all except:

A 4-month-old infant is brought to the pediatric clinic due to developmental delays and failure to thrive. The parents report that the child has exhibited hypotonia, seizures, and distinctive facial features, including a high forehead, flat nasal bridge, and large fontanelles. On examination, the infant has hepatomegaly and cataracts. A diagnosis of Zellweger syndrome was made. What is the underlying cellular component responsible for the pathophysiology of this condition?

A medical student is studying the pathophysiology of cholera, a disease caused by the bacterium Vibrio cholerae. The student learns that the severe diarrhea characteristic of cholera is mediated by a specific toxin produced by the bacteria. This toxin binds to a particular receptor on the intestinal epithelial cells, leading to an increase in intracellular cyclic AMP (cAMP) levels and subsequent electrolyte loss. Which of the following receptors does the cholera toxin primarily interact with to exert its effects?
Select the best answer For each item listed below, select the appropriate location from the drawing shown above.

In an electrophoretic separation procedure, a technician observes the migration of lipoproteins from the cathode (-) to the anode (+) side. Which of the following correctly orders the lipoproteins from cathode to anode?
Which enzyme is not involved in shuttling fatty acids into the mitochondrial matrix for β-oxidation?

A 45-year-old man undergoes a routine checkup. As part of a metabolic study, his blood is drawn three hours after consuming a mixed meal consisting of carbohydrates, proteins, and fats. The physician is analysing the postprandial (after eating) lipid profile to understand nutrient absorption and transport. Which of the following blood components is most likely to be elevated at this time?

A 45-year-old male with Type 1 diabetes mellitus presents with a blood glucose level greater than 300 mg/dl. In the context of his elevated blood glucose, which of the following metabolic processes continues to occur in this patient?

options.label: C
options.text: Increased conversion of fatty acid to Acetyl CoA

questions.correct_answer: C. Increased conversion of fatty acid to Acetyl CoA
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Increased conversion of fatty acid to Acetyl CoA

questions.text: A 45-year-old woman was brought to the hospital in a disoriented, confused state by her husband. She is a known case of type 1 diabetes for the last 25 years. O/E –she had signs of dehydration, Low BP and acidosis with faintly fruity odour. The diagnosis is:
Which of the following diseases is least likely to include neurological symptoms in its classic presentation?

A 25-year-old student has been experiencing yellowish discoloration of the palms for the past seven months, with no changes in sclera or mucous membranes and no history of chemical exposure. His lipid profile shows the below results: Laboratory investigations: Total cholesterol: 240 mg/dl (N = < 200 mg/dl), LDL cholesterol: 145 mg/dl (N = < 100 mg/dl), TG: 250 mg/dl (N = 60-150 mg/dl), HDL cholesterol: 45 mg/dl (N = 40-75 mg/dl), Lipoprotein electrophoresis shows a broad beta band. Given these findings, what is the most likely diagnosis?
The thyroid hormones T3 and T4 are synthesized in the follicular cells of the thyroid gland. From which of the following essential amino acids are the thyroid hormones synthesized?
Which one of the following amino acids is most likely to be found in the transmembrane region of a protein:
Glutathione is a critical tripeptide involved in conjugation reactions and in reactions that protect cells from reactive oxygen species. Which of the following components compose glutathione?

A 4-year-old child is brought to the clinic with developmental delays and a characteristic skin rash. Laboratory tests reveal elevated levels of tyrosine and a deficiency of a specific enzyme involved in the metabolism of tyrosine. Genetic testing confirms a defect in the enzyme that catalyzes the transamination of tyrosine. Which of the following conditions is most likely caused by a defect in tyrosine transaminase?

Following routine newborn screening, a child is found to have high levels of phenylpyruvate and phenylacetate, indicative of phenylketonuria (PKU). Despite a phenylalanine-restricted diet, the child shows developmental delays. Which supplement might improve the child's condition?

A 27-year-old male presents with recurrent kidney stones since adolescence. Stone analysis reveals calcium oxalate. Blood and urine oxalate levels are raised. Given the early-onset and stone composition, which inherited metabolic disorder is most likely?

Assertion (A): In the transmethylation process, the conversion of homocysteine to methionine requires folate and vitamin B12 as cofactors. Reasoning (R): The enzyme for this remethylation process is homocysteine methyltransferase, which requires a methyl group from methylcobalamin, which in turn, acquires the methyl group from methyl-THF (tetrahydrofolate).

options.label: A
options.text: A and R both are right but R is not the correct explanation of A

options.label: B
options.text: A is wrong but R is a right statement

options.label: C
options.text: A as well as R are right and R is a correct explanation of A

options.label: D
options.text: A and R both are wrong

questions.correct_answer: C. A as well as R are right and R is a correct explanation of A
questions.explanation: Ans. C) A as well as R are right and R is a correct explanation of A

questions.text: A biochemistry instructor is discussing protein denaturation with medical students. The instructor emphasizes the resilience of certain bonds within a protein's structure in the face of denaturing agents like heat or chemicals. The instructor asks which bond in a protein's structure is most resistant to denaturation?

A graduate student is preparing a presentation on protein folding and the role of molecular chaperones in maintaining cellular protein homeostasis. While researching, the student encounters various facts about chaperones but realizes one of the statements they've noted is incorrect. Which of the following statements about chaperones is false?

options.label: C
options.text: Ubiquitin is the most important chaperones

options.label: D
options.text: Most chaperones have associated ATPase activity

questions.correct_answer: C. Ubiquitin is the most important chaperones
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Ubiquitin is the most important chaperones

questions.text: A newborn is brought in for routine postnatal screening. The pediatrician is concerned about the possibility of inborn errors of metabolism, including phenylketonuria (PKU). Which of the following tests is considered the gold standard for screening PKU and other metabolic disorders in newborns?
Which amino acid can be converted into an intermediate that plays a role in both the citric acid cycle and the urea cycle?

During a routine neonatal examination, a newborn girl is noted to have blue eyes, blond hair, and fair skin. A Guthrie test is performed, yielding positive results. Among the following statements related to this case, which one is not true?

options.label: A
options.text: Due to deficiency of enzyme Phenylalanine Hydroxylase

options.label: B
options.text: Mental retardation is a potential complication

options.label: C
options.text: Presence of a white patch of hair is due to a deficiency of tyrosinase enzyme

options.label: D
options.text: Phenylacetate is found in the urine

questions.correct_answer: C. Presence of a white patch of hair is due to a deficiency of tyrosinase enzyme
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Presence of a white patch of hair is due to a deficiency of tyrosinase enzyme

questions.text: Carbamoyl phosphate is involved in the synthesis of:

In a clinical discussion about the biochemical roles of various coenzymes, a question arises regarding the functions of biotin. For which of the following reactions does biotin not serve as a coenzyme?

options.label: C
options.text: Propionyl CoA to Methyl Malonyl CoA

questions.correct_answer: D. Glutamate to Gamma Carboxy Glutamate
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Glutamate to Gamma Carboxy Glutamate

questions.text: During a discussion about the metabolism of vitamin D, a physician explains the process of activation to a group of medical residents. The physician asks the residents to identify where 25-hydroxycholecalciferol is hydroxylated by the 1 α-hydroxylase enzyme to form the active form of vitamin D. In which organ does this conversion predominantly occur?

The 30-year-old man came with complaints of fatigue, dizziness, light headedness, hair loss and shortness of breath. Blood picture shows microcytic hypochromic anemia. The doctor advised a vitamin along with iron supplements. Which vitamin helps in the maximum absorption of Iron?
Which of the following options correctly pairs the vitamins with their associated diseases?
Match the vitamin deficiency to the presenting symptoms:

A 40-year-old male presents to the clinic with a history of skin fragility and blistering on sun-exposed areas. He also reports significant liver disease history and excessive alcohol consumption. Laboratory tests show elevated porphyrins in urine. The patient's symptoms and laboratory findings suggest a diagnosis related to porphyrin metabolism. Which of the following types of porphyria is characterized by a deficiency in the enzyme uroporphyrinogen decarboxylase?
Gibbs free energy curve of an enzyme-catalyzed reaction is given by:
Which enzyme is known to contain the amino acid selenocysteine?
Which of the following represents the Michaelis-Menten equation accurately?

A graph is presented depicting enzyme kinetics with and without an inhibitor. The Lineweaver-Burk plot shows two lines intersecting on the y-axis. The line representing enzyme activity with an inhibitor has a different slope than that without an inhibitor, yet both lines intersect at the same point on the y-axis. Based on this information, what type of enzyme inhibition is being represented in this plot?

A 50-year-old female patient with a history of rheumatoid arthritis is started on methotrexate as part of her treatment regimen. The physician explains that this medication is an antimetabolite that interferes with the growth of rapidly dividing cells. Methotrexate is known to inhibit a specific enzyme crucial for DNA synthesis and cellular proliferation. Which of the following enzymes is primarily inhibited by methotrexate, leading to its therapeutic effects?

A patient with metastatic cancer is being treated with 5-Fluoro-Uracil (5-FU), a chemotherapeutic agent known for its role in inhibiting DNA synthesis. The clinician explains that 5-FU exerts its effects by being converted to a specific active metabolite that inhibits a crucial enzyme involved in the synthesis of thymidine. Which enzyme is inhibited by the metabolite of 5-Fluoro-Uracil, leading to thymine - less cell death?
Which of the following is not an aneuploidy?
Cytosolic Cytochrome C mediates:
Base substitution mutations can have the following molecular consequence except:

options.label: A
options.text: Changes one codon for an amino acid into another codon for that same amino acid

options.label: B
options.text: Codon for one amino acid is changed into a codon of another amino acid

options.label: C
options.text: Reading frame changes downstream to the mutant site

options.label: D
options.text: Codon for one amino acid is changed into a translation termination codon

questions.correct_answer: C. Reading frame changes downstream to the mutant site
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Reading frame changes downstream to the mutant site.

questions.text: A 4-year-old male child presents with self-mutilating behavior, including biting of fingers and lips. Laboratory findings indicate the presence of orange-colored crystals in the urine and elevated serum uric acid levels. Which of the following is responsible for the neurological features in this patient?
Termination process of protein synthesis is performed by all except:
During pyrimidine nucleotide synthesis, one of the amino acids donates a nitrogen atom to form the pyrimidine ring. Which amino acid contributes the nitrogen at the N1 position in this structure?

In a discussion on protein synthesis, a molecular biology instructor outlines the role of aminoacyl tRNAs in the translation process. These molecules are essential for delivering the appropriate amino acids to the ribosome for incorporation into the growing polypeptide chain. However, one of the amino acids mentioned is not directly incorporated by this process. Which amino acid does not require an aminoacyl tRNA for its incorporation into a protein?

In an experiment aimed at understanding DNA replication, a piece of radio-labeled DNA is allowed to undergo two rounds of replication within a non-radioactive medium. This setup is designed to track the distribution of the original radioactive material across the generations of DNA. Based on the known mechanism of semiconservative replication, what would be the expected outcome regarding the radioactivity of the DNA strands after two replication cycles?

options.label: A
options.text: All the strands will have radioactivity

options.label: C
options.text: Half of the DNA will have no radioactivity

options.label: D
options.text: Three–fourth of the DNA replicated will have radioactivity

questions.correct_answer: C. Half of the DNA will have no radioactivity
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Half of the DNA will have no radioactivity

questions.text: When considering the process of mRNA maturation in eukaryotic cells, a critical step involves the removal of certain sequences before the mRNA can be translated into a protein. There's a statement that needs verification: "Introns are excised by RNA editing." Is this statement accurate regarding the process by which introns are removed from pre-mRNA?

options.label: A
options.text: TRUE, as RNA editing is the mechanism that ensures introns are removed from pre-mRNA.

options.label: B
options.text: TRUE, because RNA editing and intron removal are synonymous terms in molecular biology.

options.label: C
options.text: FALSE, intron removal is accomplished through splicing, not RNA editing.

options.label: D
options.text: FALSE, RNA editing is primarily involved in modifying exon sequences and doesn't excise introns.

questions.correct_answer: C. FALSE, intron removal is accomplished through splicing, not RNA editing.
questions.explanation: Ans. C) FALSE, intron removal is accomplished through splicing, not RNA editing

questions.text: A 30-year-old researcher working at a medical laboratory is involved in a project focused on the protein synthesis mechanisms of a recently discovered pathogenic protozoan. While reviewing the initiation complex of translation in eukaryotes, he notes that certain components are crucial for the process. Which of the following is NOT a component of the eukaryotic initiation complex of translation?
Considering a synthetic mRNA composed entirely of adenine nucleotides (poly A), what type of polypeptide would this mRNA sequence code for?
Given the DNA template shown, with regions A, B, C, and D, which pair of primers should be used to effectively amplify this region through PCR?
Match the following codons with the correct amino acid they code for or their function in this specialized context:
Restriction fragment length polymorphism analysis can only be used to follow the inheritance of a genetic disease if:

options.label: A
options.text: mRNA probe is used in combination with antibodies

options.label: B
options.text: The disease-causing mutation is at or closely linked to restriction site

options.label: C
options.text: Mutation is outside of restriction sites so that cleaving still occurs

options.label: D
options.text: Restriction fragments remain the same size but their charge changes

questions.correct_answer: B. The disease-causing mutation is at or closely linked to restriction site
questions.explanation: Ans. B) The disease-causing mutation is at or closely linked to  restriction site

questions.text: A 3.5-year-old girl of Arabian descent presents to the clinic with severe anemia, thrombocytopenia, leukocytosis, and elevated ESR. The history provided by her parents includes fever, cough, pallor, weakness, and tachypnea. On examination, hepatomegaly is noted. Following diagnostic evaluations, sickle cell anemia (SCA) is diagnosed. Based on the information provided, which of the following statements about SCA is false?

options.label: A
options.text: RFLP result from a single base change

options.label: B
options.text: Single nucleotide change results in change of Glutamate to Valine

options.label: C
options.text: HbS confers resistance against malaria in heterozygotes

options.label: D
options.text: ‘Sticky patch’ is generated as a result of replacement of a nonpolar residue with a polar residue in Sickle Cell Anemia (HbS)

questions.correct_answer: D. ‘Sticky patch’ is generated as a result of replacement of a nonpolar residue with a polar residue in Sickle Cell Anemia (HbS)
questions.explanation: Ans. D) ‘Sticky patch’ is generated as a result of replacement of a nonpolar residue with a polar residue in Sickle Cell Anemia (HbS)

questions.text: A genetic counsellor is reviewing the case of 7-month-old boy diagnosed with Tay-Sachs disease, an autosomal recessive disorder. If son is a diagnosed case of Tay-Sachs disease, the family's pedigree and Southern blot analysis with RFLP linked to the Tay-Sachs gene have been presented to determine the genetic status of their daughter. What does the Southern blot analysis indicate regarding the daughter's genetic status concerning Tay-Sachs disease?

options.label: A
options.text: She has 25% chance of having Tay-Sachs disease.

options.label: B
options.text: She has 50% chance of having Tay-Sachs disease.

options.label: C
options.text: She is a carrier for Tay-Sachs disease.

questions.text: A researcher at a genetics laboratory is analyzing a gel-based technique for DNA analysis. The process includes the separation of DNA fragments by electrophoresis, transfer of the DNA from the gel to a nitrocellulose sheet, and identification using a labelled DNA probe. What is the molecular biology technique depicted in the image?
